data.title: All Japan Indoor Tennis Championships
data.text:
The ATP Challenger Kyoto (official name: " Shimadzu All Japan Tennis Championships ," jap島津 全日本 室内 テニス 選手権 大会, Shimazu Zen Nihon Shitsunai Tenisu Senshuken Taikai ) is held annually since 1997 tennis tournament in Kyoto, Japan. It is part of the ATP Challenger Tour and is played indoors on carpet. Takao Suzuki and Michal Tabara were able to win in a single twice, and are thus the most successful player of the tournament. In doubles, this also managed Sonchat Ratiwatana, Sanchai Ratiwatana and Martin Slanar.

Cooperation partner is the precision instrument manufacturer Shimadzu.

Doubles
